# accessibilityElementIsFocused()

**Instance Method**

Returns a Boolean value indicating whether an assistive technology is focused on the accessibility element.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor func accessibilityElementIsFocused() -> Bool
```

## Return Value

[doc://com.apple.objectivec/documentation/ObjectiveC/YES] if an assistive technology is virtually focused on the element; otherwise, [doc://com.apple.objectivec/documentation/ObjectiveC/NO].

## Getting focus information

- **accessibilityElementDidBecomeFocused()**: Sent after an assistive technology has set its virtual focus on the accessibility element.
- **accessibilityElementDidLoseFocus()**: Sent after an assistive technology has removed its virtual focus from an accessibility element.
- **accessibilityAssistiveTechnologyFocusedIdentifiers()**: Returns a set of identifier keys indicating which assistive app has focus on the accessibility element.
